thread.title: Brazil shares higher at close of trade; Bovespa up 0.13% By Investing.com
thread.title_full: Brazil shares higher at close of trade; Bovespa up 0.13% By Investing.com

author: Investing.com
title: Brazil shares higher at close of trade; Bovespa up 0.13% By Investing.com
text:
Investing.com â€“ Brazil equities were higher at the close on Thursday, as gains in the Real Estate , Public Utilities and Industrials sectors propelled shares higher.
At the close in Sao Paulo, the Bovespa rose 0.13%.
The biggest gainers of the session on the Bovespa were Minerva SA/Brazil (BVMF: BEEF3 ), which rose 5.79% or 0.28 points to trade at 5.12 at the close. Banco BTG Pactual SA (BVMF: BPAC11 ) added 2.44% or 0.68 points to end at 28.60 and Atacadao SA (BVMF: CRFB3 ) was up 2.41% or 0.13 points to 5.53 in late trade.
Biggest losers included Companhia Siderurgica Nacional (BVMF: CSNA3 ), which lost 3.99% or 0.31 points to trade at 7.45 in late trade. Hapvida Participacoes e Investimentos (BVMF: HAPV3 ) declined 3.83% or 0.09 points to end at 2.26 and Braskem SA (BVMF: BRKM5 ) shed 3.08% or 0.35 points to 11.03.
Declining stocks outnumbered rising ones by 508 to 357 and 64 ended unchanged on the B3 Stock Exchange.
The CBOE Brazil Etf Volatility , which measures the implied volatility of Bovespa options, was down 0.30% to 30.17.
In commodities trading, Gold Futures for February delivery was up 0.71% or 19.01 to $2,691.41 a troy ounce. Meanwhile, Crude oil for delivery in February rose 1.17% or 0.86 to hit $74.18 a barrel, while the March US coffee C contract rose 0.62% or 1.95 to trade at $318.40 .
USD/BRL was down 1.18% to 6.03, while EUR/BRL fell 1.35% to 6.21.
The US Dollar Index Futures was up 0.06% at 108.99.
